questions.question_text:
The VP of Finance wants to ensure that once an opportunity is closed, it cannot be modified by any user.
How can an administrator meet this requirement?

choices.C: Milestones can be created dynamically based on other fields
choices.B: The Manage Entitlements permission must be enabled
choices.D: Entitlement versioning allows changes to existing entitlement processes
choices.A: Entitlements have their own organization-wide default settings

discussion.content:
B. The Manage Entitlements permission must be enabled.
D. Entitlement versioning allows changes to existing entitlement processes.

The following are the explanations for the above two options:

B. The Manage Entitlements permission must be enabled to create entitlement processes. This permission is included in the “Manage Entitlements” profile permission and the “Modify All Data” permission.

D. Entitlement versioning allows changes to existing entitlement processes. With entitlement versioning, administrators can make changes to the entitlement process without affecting any entitlements that are already in use. Administrators can create a new version of an entitlement process and specify the start and end dates for each version. This allows for changes to be made to the entitlement process without disrupting existing entitlements.

C. Use a workflow that populates Billing State/Province based on a custom object that maps postal codes to states/provinces.

The following are the explanations for the above two options:

B. Use a validation rule to do a VLOOKUP of the Billing Postal Code to a custom object that maps postal codes to states/provinces. This solution will work by creating a custom object that maps the postal codes to their respective state/province. C. Use a workflow that populates Billing State/Province based on a custom object that maps postal codes to states/provinces. This solution works similarly to the validation rule approach, but uses a workflow to automate the process.

discussion.content:
Which type of relationship should an administrator use to ensure that expense line items can be aggregated?

B. Master-detail

The question is "Which type of relationship"? Roll-up Summary is a feature of the Master-Detail relationship.

D. Roll-up summary

The roll-up summary relationship type should be used to aggregate values from expense line item records and display them on the expense record. The roll-up summary field can perform calculations on child records and display the result on the parent record.
